title.narrative: GIRLS AND BOYS AND THEIR FAMILY EMPOWERED TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO VIOLENCE

description.narrative: All girls and boys and their families are empowered to prevent and respond to violence, neglect, abandonment and exploitation., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 all girls and boys, including adolescents in all settings, are protected from violence, neglect, abandonment and exploitation.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Parent/caregiver education and programmes contributing to prevention of violence, exploitation, abuse and neglect - across the life cycle
Research, evaluation and other evidence generation and use - Violence, exploitation, abuse and neglect
Response and support services for girls, boys, and women experiencing violence, exploitaiton, abuse and neglect
Social and behaviour change and community engagement on VAC
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: All girls and boys and their families are empowered to prevent and respond to violence, neglect, abandonment and exploitation.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the government to develop and disseminate messages around the risks of violence during COVID-19 infection-prevention control measures (lockdowns), online child protection risks, and the risks of infection for particularly vulnerable children. Adolescent participation in Violence Against Children prevention and input into decisions, including on access to services, was supported through a partnership with Collectif des Ligues et Associations de Défense des Droits de l’Homme au Rwanda (CLADHO) in 13 districts across the country. ; | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/12/2021
